info.document:
Rachel Roy's beautiful daughters want to get into modeling, but the fashion designer wants to make sure they have a healthy perspective on the industry.

At a UN Women forum on Thursday, Roy told Page Six that she tells her daughters, 17-year-old Ava and 9-year-old Tallulah: "Even if aesthetically you are not what someone is looking for, you have to walk in there knowing that it's their loss. It's the company's loss. They just don't get it and you didn't want to work there anyway."

"It's such a balance because I think men's egos are influenced by what they do for a living and I wish that women's were, but I think that most women's egos are influenced by how people perceive them on the outside," the 43-year-old said.

To instill the tenets of feminism in her daughters, Roy tries to teach them self-love. "Unfortunately, to really grow as a person, they're going to have to feel a little bit of pain and, as a mom, I don't want to give them that, but the coolest people that I know in my life have been through lots of downs," she said. "That will hopefully give them their value."
